meanings.def: the crime of killing somebody deliberately
examples: He was found guilty of murder.
She has been charged with the attempted murder of her husband.
Who is responsible for this brutal murder?
to commit (a) murder
He was arrested on suspicion of murder.
a murder case/investigation/charge/trial
The rebels were responsible for the mass murder of 400 civilians.
the families of the murder victims
What was the murder weapon?
The play is a murder mystery.
He was convicted of the murder of a police officer.
He committed the perfect murder and left no forensic evidence.
She plays a detective investigating a double murder.
He ordered the murder of his political opponents.
He vowed to avenge his brother's murder.
Her latest novel is a gripping murder mystery.
It was a murder which shocked the nation.
Nothing justifies murder.
The city used to be the murder capital of the world.
a city that has the highest murder rate in the US
a verdict of wilful murder
murders committed by terrorists
new evidence that implicated her in the murder
the wholesale murder of innocent citizens
She had committed the murder the night before her thirtieth birthday.

meanings.def: used to describe something that is difficult or unpleasant
examples: It's murder trying to get to the airport at this time of day.
It was murder (= very busy and unpleasant) in the office today.

meanings.def: to do whatever you want without being stopped or punished
examples: They let their children get away with murder!

meanings.def: to scream loudly and for a long time, especially in order to protest about something

idioms.def: to do whatever you want without being stopped or punished
examples: They let their children get away with murder!

idioms.def: to scream loudly and for a long time, especially in order to protest about something

related: somebody will/is going to murder you, me, etc.

meanings.def: to kill somebody deliberately and illegally
examples: He denies murdering his wife's lover.
The boy was brutally murdered.
The murdered woman was well known in the area.
She was convicted of attempting to murder her husband.
He was found murdered in the cemetery.
Thirty people were murdered that day.
She was arrested and charged with murdering the two children.
They were murdered in cold blood.
He uncovered a conspiracy to murder the royal family.

meanings.def: to change something good into something bad because you do not do it very well
examples: Critics accused him of murdering the English language (= writing or speaking it very badly).

meanings.def: to defeat somebody completely, especially in a team sport
examples: England are getting murdered at the moment.

meanings.def: used to say that you very much want to eat or drink something
examples: I could murder a beer.

meanings.def: used to warn or predict that another person will be very angry with somebody/you
examples: She's going to murder me if I don't get this finished on time.

idioms.def: used to say that you very much want to eat or drink something
examples: I could murder a beer.

idioms.idiom: somebody will/is going to murder you, me, etc.
idioms.def: used to warn or predict that another person will be very angry with somebody/you
examples: She's going to murder me if I don't get this finished on time.
